msgSnippet: HOME is one of the environment variables you get for free with Unix. Start up a shell and type: echo $HOME and you ll see something meaningful. For example,

HOME is one of the environment variables you get for "free" with Unix. Star=
t up a shell and type:

echo $HOME

and you'll see something meaningful. Fo=
r example, my short userid on my mac is "simon", so when I type the above c=
ommand I get:

/Users/simon

Simon
